title: Defence giant BAE hails record sales as workers remain on strike
partialText: Defence company BAE has increased payouts to investors after its sales increased but staff in Lancashire have walked out over stalled pay talks

title: Lower fuel prices and airfares help drive inflation down
partialText: The rate at which prices are rising is slowing down, which could lead to lower interest rates.

title: Plan to increase youth minimum wage could be delayed
partialText: Government sources tell BBC News they could slow down plans to make minimum wage equal across age groups.

title: Illegal skin lightening cream being sold in UK butchers, watchdog warns
partialText: A trade body has warned illegal skin bleaching products are being sold in an increasingly wide range of places.

title: 'Check your payslip' warns nurse who overpaid nearly £3k in tax
partialText: Gemma Belby says she only found she was paying "double tax" after chatting with her colleagues.

title: Reddit's human content wins amid the AI flood
partialText: Reddit says its human contributors are valued amid an internet awash with AI-generated content.

title: 'I do not trust them' - top streamers left concerned by Discord age checks
partialText: The platform's plan to roll out global age checks has caused concern in streaming communities.

title: 'The search is soul-destroying': Young jobseekers on the struggle to find work
partialText: People aged between 16 and 24 are bearing the brunt of a weak employment market, figures show.

title: Reform plans to keep UK's budget watchdog
partialText: Robert Jenrick promises to reform the OBR, rather than abolish it, in a move to reassure financial markets.

title: I invested £12,000 in Brewdog  - I think I've lost it all
partialText: More than 200,000 people bought Equity for Punks shares in the craft brewer but many now believe they are worthless.

title: Shein under EU investigation over childlike sex dolls
partialText: Europe is examining whether the fast fashion giant breached the Digital Services Act.

title: UK unemployment hits highest rate for nearly five years
partialText: It marks the highest rate since the Covid pandemic, official figures show.

title: Bayer offers $7.25bn to settle weedkiller cancer claims
partialText: The company has faced years of legal battles over Roundup, a weedkiller made by Monsanto.

title: Calculator: How will freeze on tax thresholds hit your take-home pay?
partialText: Wages have been rising faster than prices but you could pay more tax because of frozen thresholds.

title: Royal Mail given two weeks to respond to claims it is prioritising parcels

title: Dual nationals face scramble for UK passports as new rules come into force
partialText: Entry requirements to the UK for dual nationals are being overhauled as part of sweeping changes to the immigration system.

title: Hyatt Hotels chairman steps down over Jeffrey Epstein ties
partialText: Billionaire Thomas Pritzker said he had exercised "terrible judgement" in keeping contact with Epstein.

title: Ex-Carillion boss fined for 'reckless' actions

title: Six of Sarah Ferguson's companies winding down
partialText: The move follows further revelations over her friendship with the convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Could Bill Gates and political tussles overshadow AI safety debate in Delhi?
partialText: As global tech leaders meet Delhi, India hopes to level the playing field for countries outside the US and China.

title: ByteDance to curb AI video app after Disney legal threat
partialText: Videos featuring Spider-Man and other characters which are Disney's intellectual property have gone viral since Seedance's update.

title: Lloyds boss accepts concern over use of staff data in pay talks
partialText: The bank was criticised for comparing employees' spending habits to the wider public as part of wage negotiations.

title: Royal Mail letters sit undelivered 'for weeks' as parcels prioritised, staff say
partialText: Staff and customers tell the BBC prioritising parcels can mean missed NHS appointments and late payment fines.

title: Brewdog staff 'upset and concerned' by sale plans
partialText: Unite said workers had been left in the dark over their futures after the craft beer firm announced plans to explore new investment.

title: Bedding firm backs down on 'Swift Home' trademark after Taylor Swift appeal
partialText: Swift’s team had flagged similarities between her trademark and the company’s contested design.

title: Could Manchester be a model for the UK to kickstart growth?
partialText: With an annual growth rate of 3.1%, Manchester's economy has performed twice as well as that of the UK as a whole.

title: The £10 tricks I used to make my rented room into a home

title: Trump eyes Venezuela visit – but obstacles to his oil plan remain

title: Get a grip: Robotics firms struggle to develop hands
partialText: Developing a durable and affordable hand is one of the biggest challenges in robotics.

title: Who is billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe and how did he make his money?

title: The US economy is growing - so where are all the jobs?

title: The Dutch love four-day working weeks, but are they sustainable?

title: Why food fraud persists, even with improving tech
partialText: Even with sophisticated technology it is still difficult to detect fake foods.

title: Netflix and Paramount are battling for Warner Bros. Who is likely to win?

title: How £50m 'fish disco' could save farmland

title: Plane makers chase Asia's super-rich with luxe new private jets

title: Rise in tax-free pay allowance 'totally positive'

partialText: There is a fine balance between the benefits of improved infrastructure, versus the cost of disruption. Does the country have it right?

partialText: Parts of Britain’s rail network will close for engineering work over the festive period - but is that the right time to do it?
